REPORTED NAMES
:
Ehlersia cornuta (Rathke, 1843 )
;
Langerhansia cornuta (Rathke 1843 )
. REMARKS : This species was commonly reported from both hard and soft bottoms in the whole Adriatic Sea. According to
Licher ( 1999 )
and
San MartÃ­n ( 2003 )
,
S. cornuta
is not present in the Mediterranean Sea, being typical of boreal regions.
San MartÃ­n ( 2003 )
assigned the previous records of the species that were based on Campoy's ( 1982 ) description of
S. cornuta
to
S. parapari
San MartÃ­n & LÃ³pez, 2000 .
Mikac and Musco ( 2010 )
hypothesized that the previous records of
S. cornuta
in the NA possibly refer to
S. beneliahuae (
Campoy & AlquÃ©zar, 1982
)
,
S. rosea Langerhans, 1879
,
S. garciai (
Campoy, 1982
)
or
S. parapari
.

subSubSection.paragraph: DISTRIBUTION : NA , SA.

Â®
Syllis parapari
San MartÃ­n & LÃ³pez, 2000
DISTRIBUTION : NA .

NEW
RECORDS
: BM 52 , BM 53 , BM 54 , BM 65 , BM 66 .

REMARKS : These are the first records from the Adriatic Sea. According to
San MartÃ­n ( 2003 )
the previous findings of
Syllis cornuta (Rathke, 1843 )
in the Mediterranean Sea should be attributed to
S. parapari
. It is also possible that at least some of the former Adriatic findings of
S. cornuta
, especially those from the soft bottoms, belong to
S. parapari (
Mikac & Musco 2010
)
. Analyses of some specimens collected within the present research and firstly determined as
S. alosae
San MartÃ­n, 1992
, were re-examined by G. San MartÃ­n and revealed to be
S. parapari
.
Syllis alosae
was originally described from the Caribbean Sea (
San MartÃ­n 1992
), and although it has been cited in some papers for the Mediterranean area, its presence in the Mediterranean is considered doubtful, since no taxonomic re-descriptions from the European waters are up to now available (WoRMS 2014 ). Thus previous records of
S. alosae
in the southern Adriatic by
Castelli et al . ( 2008 )
and Giangrande et al . ( 2003 ) are herein considered erroneous identifications, as they may refer to
S. parapari
.

Syllis pontxioi
San MartÃ­n & LÃ³pez, 2000 DISTRIBUTION : SA.

LITERATURE
RECORDS
: Musco et al . 2004 ;
Castelli et al . 2008
.
DISTRIBUTION : NA , CA, SA.

OTHER
REPORTED NAMES
:
Typosyllis prolifera (Krohn, 1852 )
;
Syllis fiumensis
Ehlers 1864
;
Syllis lussinensis
Grube 1863
;
Syllis bouvieri Gravier, 1900
;
Syllis zonata Haswell, 1883
.

REMARKS : Following the proposal of
Licher ( 1999 )
,
Syllis zonata Haswell, 1883
and
S. bouvieri Gravier, 1900
(reported in Fraschetti et al. 2002 ; Giangrande et al. 2003, 2004 ) are here considered as synonyms of
S. prolifera
. However, according to
Castelli et al. ( 2008 )
S. zonata
and
S. bouvieri
could be valid species.
DISTRIBUTION : SA.

LITERATURE
RECORDS
: Giangrande et al . 2003, 2004 ; Musco et al . 2004 ;
Castelli et al . 2008
;
Musco 2012
.
